intro: Lavatera salvitellensis, commonly known as the silky bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, silvery-green foliage and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its fluffy seed heads add visual interest throughout the growing season.
